revised_title: Susceptibility of Goats to Malta Fever and Transmission to Humans
tldr: The author conducted experiments to determine if goats are susceptible to Malta fever and if the disease can be transmitted to humans through goats. They found that goats can be infected with the Micrococcus melitensis bacterium and that their blood serum can agglutinate the bacteria. This suggests that goats may be a source of infection for humans.
